intro: Isertia glabra, commonly known as the smooth isertia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its smooth, glabrous leaves and yellow-orange flowers make it easily identifiable. Isertia glabra is often found in regions with temperate climates and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
